attributes.action: Mediate with South African officials to prevent land expropriation.
attributes.additional_details: Constitution of the Republic of South Africa, 1996; TAU SA "International Bulletin: Cyril and the Stockholm Syndrome" by Henk, South Africa Bulletin TAU SA in Pretoria, 31st Jan. '18 (archived source: http://archive.is/9D9fH); "Britain must intervene in SA land debate", the Independent, 2nd Mar. '18 (archived source: http://archive.is/UWMDH); "South Africa Parliament votes to confiscate white-owned land without compensation" news.com.au, 28th Feb. '18 (archived source: http://archive.is/noLOw)
attributes.background: South Africa's National Assembly recently voted to expropriate urban & rural property from white families without compensation. This year, the Constitutional Court will vote on amending ss.25 of the Bill of Rights "Property". HMG should mediate with the Gov't of SA to prevent this racist injustice.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
